column4: I'm trying to extract a tar.gz, and it says I do not have the right permissions... Whast is the command for extracting?
tar -xvf <file>.tar.gz
Where do I put where I want it to extract?
but you need to be in a folder that your user can write to or else you would have to use sudo
Or is it earier to just move it to that folder first?
-C <place to extract>
yes that's how it works when you switch sides of the cube that is your other workspace you get 4
But it isn't spinning like a cube.
you sure what does ctrl+alt+up arrow do for you
it shows you the top of the cube :)
it makes everything fade except my browser
ctrl+a TAB
Thanks... when I switch to the other I can;t seem to do anything...
yeah you eon't until you create a new shell in it
How do I do that?
ctrl+a C
if you d ctrl+a N it makes a "clone" of your one window just incase you hit N sometime :)
yikes, somehow I got htop in both of them./
then you most likely pressed the wrong key
Haha, I think you're right.
(I'm concurrently trying to learn to type on a dvorak board, on my qwerty hardware... makes it difficult.)
Got it, thanks!
And it works, thanks.
